titleStmt.title: Jeff Burnett et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2369

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersigned citizens of the 4th Justices District of Hancock County Ky represent that there is a vacancy in the Office of Justice of the Peace in said district occasioned by the removal of Miles Hughes. We would suggest to your Excellency the appointment of Stephen H. C Lewis to said office. --

Jeff Burnett
Robert Hardy
Bery Lynch
Wm Cook
Wayman Cooper
J. K. Johnson
W. B Mays.
A. C Lindsay
John Swigfurt
Henry Paul.
T. G. Lynch
G H Roberts
J. H. Matews
S. B. Burnett
Wm B. Lindle
Hawkins Lindle
John Probus
T. F. Tindle
J A Clark
H Tindler Jr
Wm Clark
Wm Strick
Thos ogden
C. E. Price
T. M Wheatly
Wilfred Hayes
H. E. Haynes
A. J Logden
Jacob Swear.
D L Adair
Frank Gest
C J Sterett
D Davison
N Stark
Thos. Clark
Green Sterrett
R G Lift
T M Newman
Band Sterett
Jeff Richey
R. C. Walker
Jas Burnett
Sylvester Key
Geo Jarboe
Stephen Burditt

Hancock Co
J. P.
Dist No 4
S. H. C. Lewis
vice
M. Hughes
appd. Decr. 1. 1860
